intro: Trasus paniceus, commonly known as panicled tracheophyte, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like structure with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces wind-pollinated flowers, which are typically green or pale in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Trasus paniceus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects and small animals.
